block.p: A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on in and around Westchester and Putnam Counties this week. Items for the guide should be sent at least three weeks in advance to westweek@nytimes.com, or by mail to Westchester Cultural Calendar, 229 West 43rd Street, New York, N.Y. 10036-3959.
COMEDY
Valhalla ''The Male Intellect: An Oxymoron?'' stand-up by Robert Dubac. June 9 at 8 p.m. $15 and $17. Westchester Community College, Academic Arts Theater, 75 Grasslands Road. (914) 606- 6262.
FILM
Nyack Sing-along screening of ''The Wizard of Oz.'' June 10 at 5 p.m. $6 and $8. Riverspace, 119 Main Street. (845) 348-0741.

Peekskill ''The Wind That Shakes the Barley,'' directed by Ken Loach. Thursday through June 10. $7 and $9. ''Killer of Sheep,'' directed by Charles Burnett. June 10 through 16. $7 and $9. Paramount Center for the Arts, 1008 Brown Street. (914) 739-2333.

Yonkers ''Something Like Happiness,'' directed by Bohdan Slama; in Czech with English subtitles. Wednesday at 2 p.m. Free. Yonkers Public Library, Grinton I. Will branch, 1500 Central Park Avenue. (914) 337-1500.
FOR CHILDREN
Bronx ''Mud, Buds and Blooms,'' family activity. Through June 29. New York Botanical Garden, Bronx River Parkway and Fordham Road. (718) 817-8616.
Nyack Milk and Cookies Playhouse: Danna Banana, family musician. June 9 at 10 a.m. $7 and $9. Riverspace, 119 Main Street. (845) 348-0741.
Yonkers ''Music and Merriment,'' children's program. Ages 2 to 5. Through June 20. Yonkers Crestwood Library, 16 Thompson Street. (914) 337-1500, Extension 360.
OUTDOORS
Garrison Annual Snapping Turtle Walk, lecture and walk. June 9 at 7 a.m. $7 and $10. Boscobel Restoration, 1601 Route 9D. (845) 265-3638, Extension 115.
Valhalla Albanian heritage festival. June 10, noon to 7 p.m. Free. Kensico Dam Plaza, north end of the Bronx River Parkway. (914) 864-7275.

White Plains Annual White Plains outdoor arts festival, with exhibits, workshops, performances and food. Through June 3. Free. Tibbits Park, North Broadway between Main and Lake Streets. (914) 993-8271.
MUSIC AND DANCE

Bronx ''The Boogie Down Dance Series,'' spring dance festival with the Bronx Dance Coalition: ''Movement in the Bronx,'' dance co-presented by the Movement Research Spring Festival. Wednesday at 8 p.m. $12 to $15. Bronx Academy of Arts and Dance, 841 Barretto Street. (718) 842-5223.
Bronx ''Bronx River Sounds,'' annual summer performing arts series: Randy Johnston Trio, jazz. June 9 at 6 p.m. $10. Bronx River Art Center, 1087 Tremont Avenue. (718) 589-5819.
Croton-on-Hudson Shenole Latimer, jazz saxophonist, and his trio. June 9 at 7:30 p.m. Free. Croton Free Library, 171 Cleveland Drive. (914) 271-6612.

Hastings-on-Hudson ''The Art of Improvisation,'' interactive program with David Janeway, jazz pianist and composer. June 9 at 7:30 p.m. Suggested donation: $5. First Unitarian Society of Westchester, 25 Jackson Avenue. (914) 478-2710.

Katonah Second Saturday celebration, with food, drinks and music by the Disappointments. June 9, 6:30 to 8:30 p.m. $10 and $15. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Katonah Museum of Art, Route 22 at Jay Street. (914) 232-9555.
Morris Township Wyeth Jazz Showcase: Bob Milne, pianist. Monday at 8 p.m. $13 and $15. Bickford Theater, 6 Normandy Heights Road. (973) 971-3706.

New Rochelle The Sound Shore Chorale's annual spring concert; Purcell's ''Dido and Aeneas'' and ''Ode to St. Cecilia.'' June 10 at 4 p.m. $12 and $15. Presbyterian Church of New Rochelle, 50 Pintard Avenue. (914) 636-1583.
Nyack Jazz in the Cafe: The Duane Eubanks Quartet. June 3 at 4 p.m. $4 and $8. Riverspace, 119 Main Street. (845) 348-0741.

Pawling Charlotte Kendrick and Dan Rowe, with the Jason Spooner Trio. Friday at 9 p.m. $15 and $17.50. Chris Smither, singer-songwriter. June 9 at 9 p.m. $25 and $27.50. Cheryl Wheeler, singer-songwriter. June 10 at 8 p.m. $25 and $27.50. Towne Crier Cafe, 130 Route 22. (845) 855-1300.
Pleasantville Concert by the faculty of the Academy of Music Arts. June 3 at 7 p.m. Free. Presbyterian Church, 400 Bedford Road. (914) 769-1782.
Poughkeepsie Joan Armatrading, blues. June 3 at 7 p.m. $44.50 and $49.50. Bardavon 1869 Opera House, 35 Market Street. (845) 473-2072.
Purchase Pandit Jasraj, classical Hindustani vocalist. June 9 at 6:30 p.m. $30 to $250. Performing Arts Center, 735 Anderson Hill Road. (914) 251-6200.
Tarrytown The Dave Brubeck Quartet, jazz. June 9 at 8 p.m. $45. Tarrytown Music Hall, 13 Main Street. (877) 840-0457.
Yonkers ''Concerto Time at the Orchestra,'' performed by the Yonkers Philharmonic Orchestra. June 10 at 3 p.m. Free. Saunders High School, 183 Palmer Road. (914) 423-3592.

Yonkers ''An Afternoon of Music From Around the World,'' by Eranga and Prianga Pieris, singers. June 3 at 2 p.m. Free. Yonkers Public Library, Grinton I. Will Branch, 1500 Central Park Avenue. (914) 337-1500.

Yorktown Heights ''Rock on for Rights,'' human rights festival with Richie Havens and others. June 3, 11 a.m. to 4 p.m. $10. Franklin Delano Roosevelt State Park, 2957 Crompond Road. www.rockonforrights.org.
THEATER
Croton Falls ''The Sisters Rosensweig,'' comedy by Wendy Wasserstein. Through June 24. $25 and $29. Schoolhouse Theater, 3 Owens Road. (914) 277-8477.
Mohegan Lake ''Blithe Spirit,'' by Noel Coward, presented by YCP TheaterWorks. Through June 10. $12 and $15. Van Cortlandtville School, Route 6. (914) 528-4145.

Montrose ''Salome,'' staged reading adapted from the drama by Oscar Wilde; presented by M and M Productions and YCP TheaterWorks. June 10 at 2 p.m. Free. Hendrick Hudson Free Library, 185 Kings Ferry Road. (914) 739-5654.
Nyack ''The Key to Al-Saheed,'' one-act developmental play by Samuel Harps. Thursday and Friday at 8 p.m. $10. Riverspace, 119 Main Street. (845) 348-0741.
Stony Point ''Half and Half,'' comedy by James Sherman. Through June 10. $15 to $30. Penguin Repertory Company, 7 Crickettown Road. (845) 786-2873.

Tarrytown ''Into the Woods,'' musical by James Lapine and Stephen Sondheim, presented by the Lighthouse Youth Theater. Through June 3. $18 to $55. Tarrytown Music Hall, 13 Main Street. (877) 840-0457.
MUSEUMS AND GALLERIES

Armonk ''Frank Lloyd Wright and Usonia: An Experiment in Living.'' Through June 24. Hours: Saturdays and Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. The Studio: An Alternative Space for Contemporary Art, 2 Maryland Avenue. (914) 273-1452.

Beacon Photography and mixed media by Christopher Staples; halogen light installation by Augustine Della Vecchia. Through June 3. ''Bau 30: Fresh Ink, A Printmaking Event,'' created by Elizabeth Winchester. June 9 through July 8. Reception: June 9, 6 to 9 p.m. and July 8, 4 to 6 p.m.; panel discussion at the Howland Cultural Center, June 24 at 4 p.m. Hours: Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 6 p.m. Beacon Artists Union (bau), 161 Main Street. (845) 440-7584.

Beacon '' Models on MainStreet,'' photography group show. Through June 3. Hours: Mondays through Thursdays, 6 a.m. to 10 p.m.; Fridays, 6 a.m. to 11 p.m.; Saturdays, 7 a.m. to 11 p.m.; Sundays, 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. Muddy Cup Coffee House, 129 Main Street. (845) 440-8855.
Bronx ''Transit,'' video installation by the artist, choreographer and musician Eleanor Dubinsky. Through June 9. Suggested donation: $5. Bronx River Art Center, 1087 Tremont Avenue. (718) 589-5819.

Dobbs Ferry ''Flight Patterns,'' mixed-media show by David Barnett; with abstract paintings by June Otani. Through June 24. Reception: June 3, 2 to 5 p.m. Hours: Thursdays through Sundays, 12:30 to 5:30 p.m. Upstream Gallery, 26 Main Street. (914) 674-8548.

Hudson ''Two People, Two Visions: Moscow and Saint Petersburg,'' photography by Barbara Birmingham and Wendy Chan. Through June 10. Hours: Mondays through Saturdays, noon to 5 p.m. Hudson Opera House, 327 Warren Street. (518) 822-1438.

Hudson ''Altered States,'' paintings by Michal Bachi and photography by Cynthia Greig. June 9 through July 21. Reception: June 9, 6 to 8 p.m. Hours: Thursdays through Mondays, noon to 6 p.m. Nicole Fiacco Gallery, 506 Warren Street. (518) 828-5090.

Liberty ''Small Works,'' mixed-media group show by area artists; part of Liberty's bicentennial celebration. Through July 1. Hours: Fridays and Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Catskill Artists Gallery, 38 South Main Street. (845) 292-0310.

New Rochelle ''Byron Goto: A Retrospective,'' mixed-media exhibit. Through June 17. Hours: Tuesdays and Wednesdays, 10 a.m. to 8 p.m.; Thursdays and Fridays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 4 p.m. Castle Gallery, 29 Castle Place. (914) 654-5423.
New Rochelle ''Borderland,'' group show. Through June 9. Hours: Thursdays and Saturdays, 1 to 5 p.m. Third Rail Studio, 49 Plain Avenue. (914) 712-9831.

North Salem ''Brush with Nature,'' group exhibition featuring traditional and modern brush painting techniques. Through Tuesday. ''Straddling Cultures,'' ceramics by Reena Kashyap. Wednesday through Sept. 8. Reception: June 9, 1 to 5 p.m. Hammond Museum and Japanese Stroll Garden, 28 Deveau Road. (914) 669-5033.

Peekskill ''Paintings From Three Perceptions 2004-2007,'' exhibition by Edward A. Burke. Friday through July 31. Reception: Friday, 4 to 7 p.m. Hours: Fridays through Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m., or by appointment. Gallery 25N, 25 North Division Street. (914) 293-0811.
Peekskill ''The Art of Persuasion,'' prints from the New York Society of Etchers. Through June 29. Paramount Center for the Arts, 1008 Brown Street. (914) 739-2333.
Pelham Paintings by Liang Guo. Through June 23. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. Pelham Art Center, 155 Fifth Avenue. (914) 738-2525.
Poughkeepsie Photography by Claudia Gorman. Through June 10. Guided daily house tours. Through Nov. 30. $6 and $9. Locust Grove, 2683 South Road (Route 9). (845) 454-4500, Extension 17.

Poughkeepsie ''Utopian Mirage: Social Metaphors in Contemporary Photography and Film,'' group show of contemporary works. Through July 29. Reception: Friday and June 9, with tours and a panel discussion. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Vassar College, Frances Lehman Loeb Art Center. (845) 437-5632.

Purchase ''Fugitive Artist: The Early Work of Richard Prince, 1974-77.'' Through June 24. ''Lesley Dill: Tremendous World,'' installations. Through June 3. $3 to $5; members and children 12 and under, free. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Neuberger Museum of Art, 735 Anderson Hill Road. (914) 251-6100.

Riverdale ''Mind, Body and Land: Photographs From Israel,'' work by Karen Gillerman-Harel. Through July 9. Hours: Daily, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. Hebrew Home at Riverdale, 5901 Palisade Avenue. (718) 581-1596.

Rye ''Spotlight on Historical Costumes,'' a collection of seasonal costumes. Through Thursday. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 9 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 3 p.m. Square House Museum, 1 Purchase Street. (914) 967-7588.

Scarsdale ''Words: From Spoken to Seen,'' paintings by Wosene Worke Kosrof. Through June 30. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. Madelyn Jordon Fine Art, 14 Chase Road. (914) 723-8738.

White Plains ''Seeing Stories,'' group show by area children's book illustrators. June 9 through July 28. Open house, with family workshops: June 9, noon to 5 p.m. Arts Exchange, 31 Mamaroneck Avenue. (914) 428-4220, Extension 223.

A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on in and around Westchester and Putnam Counties this week. Items for the guide should be sent at least three weeks in advance to westweek@nytimes.com, or by mail to Westchester Cultural Calendar, 229 West 43rd Street, New York, N.Y. 10036-3959.
